Articles.Content:
Haven't been able to find much info - is KSC2 just for looks, or can we actually launch from there?

(without Extraplanetary Launchpads, that is)

Edited December 19, 2013 by MilkToast

Just for looks.

While a total bummer, it's kindof what I figured.

Thanks for the speedy response.

You can launch, you just need to build your rocket on top of a rover/crawler. Then move the crawler to KSC2 and launch. It won't be perfect, as you're actually launching from the crawler, but it'll get you the location. Oh, and it might take many hours to move the crawler.

You might try to see if HyperEdit can put your ships there.

You can launch, you just need to build your rocket on top of a rover/crawler. Then move the crawler to KSC2 and launch. It won't be perfect, as you're actually launching from the crawler, but it'll get you the location. Oh, and it might take many hours to move the crawler.

You might try to see if HyperEdit can put your ships there.

While a good (and therefore appreciated) suggestion, this seems a little bit of overkill to me.

Like finely shredding paper before burning it.
Your question was whether you can launch or not. You can. It's not ideal and it's not fun, but you can do it. Some folks like the challenge and have done just what I described.
